    • Constructor Detail

      • BombGuy

        public BombGuy(int x,
               int y,
               int i_pos,
               int j_pos,
               processing.core.PImage[][] sprites,
               int lives,
               Map map)
        Constructor for the main player
        Parameters:
        x - x position of BombGuy, amount of pixels to the right (for drawing)
        y - y position of BombGuy, amount of pixels downwards (for drawing)
        i_pos - the row within the map array where BombGuy is located
        j_pos - the column within the map array where BombGuy is located
        sprites - the sprite array, with each row corresponding to a sprite array for different movement directions
        lives - the number of lives that BombGuy is to start with
        map - the map object that the BombGuy is placed within

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        To be executed once every frame, calls GameObject.sprite_cycle() and checkKill()
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Calls GameObject.resetPos() and changes the sprite being drawn to the first sprite in the cycle array
        Specified by:
        reset in class GameObject

      • collisionCondition

        public void collisionCondition(demolition.Direction d,
                               Map map)
        Called when BombGuy collides with a wall
        Specified by:
        collisionCondition in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        d - Cardinal direction in which GameObject is colliding in
        map - Map object which the GameObject is situated in

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin()
        Checks whether BombGuy is on a GOAL tile
        Returns:
        true if BombGuy is on a goal tile, false if on any other tile

      • checkKill

        public void checkKill()
        Checks if BombGuy is on the same tile as an enemy and calls kill() if so

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Decrements the number of lives, and calls Map.resetLevel()

      • getLives

        public int getLives()
        Returns:
        number of lives remaining

      • setLives

        public void setLives(int lives)
        Parameters:
        lives - number of lives to change to
